item.description:
Please RSVP!

Market Talk - Open Discussion led by Jeff

We will be leveraging the intellectual horsepower of the room to divine the markets direction and discuss themes pertinent to the economy and trading it.

Stock Picks by Chris Jones

Bring your tickers - the group will analyze them on the fly
The Art of the Pullback, Part 2 by Rondeau Flynn

Futures Trader Rondeau Flynn will conclude in part 2 of Price pattern recognition-“The Art of The Pullback” . Part 1 touched on the ease of identifying one price pattern for entry, and using a unique measure of volatility for an exit. Part 2 will cover an equally simple pattern that investors/traders can use for trend entry, and capture moves in the direction of the overall trend. Except an evening of technical analysis the easy way, Q & A, and on open forum discussion. Bring your charts to be discussed, and see how easy it is to enter trends.

-January Effect 90%+ accurate ( S&P 500) for the year, going back over 50 years.
-12 of 18 Bear markets started with a “down” January.
-Areas with slightly better averages to “shine” or out perform the market
Emerging markets (I like Country ETF’S), Fixed Income Strategies, Slowly rising commodity prices and the US Dollar.

Simple Trend Entries- Concept: To participate in the overall trend of the market.

-Markets above the 200MA Dow, Nasdaq, S&P500 50% or more of total equities
-Look for “3” or more lower closes, the more the better ie. 4, 5, or 6. This is considered a “pullback”, where large institutions will be looking to get back into the overall trend of the market.
-Enter on the “Pattern” and look to use the ATR(3) as your stop target, and first profit target, then scale out from there.
-Use stops with risk adverse strategies, and focus on capital preservation.

Gold, Zero Coupon Bonds, or Equities?

Stock Screens led by Jeff

An interactive session designed to ferret out a few more stock ideas



The agenda:
5:30 Boston Tiger Financial Group Meeting (see below)
7:00 Introduction, Announcements, Polls by Jeff
7:10 Market Talk / Open Discussion
7:40 Stock Picks - Chris
8:00 Break
8:10 The Art of the Pullback, Part 2 by Rondeau Flynn
9:15 Stock Screens led by Jeff


BOSTON TIGER PRE-MEETING Announcement:
The Boston Tiger Meeting of the Tiger Financial Network meets during the hour from 5:30 PM to 6:50 PM. Go to http://www.tfnn.com/b... to see the full announcement. For questions, see Bob Podd at bpodd@softwareresults.com. The meeting is the same room as the 7:00 meeting.

To join our online discussion go to
http://groups.google....
or send email to Jeff Orrik at orrik@comcast.net

In order to identify people who evidence expertise in particular interests we have virtual trading.
To join in our virtual trading, go to this link for instructions and signup links:
http://groups.google....

If you have a friend you talk stocks with, bring them with you!

Food or drinks are not allowed in any MIT meeting room.

We strongly urge each person to make his or her own decisions about investing their money. Investment ideas and recommendations made during our meetings and in our online dialogs bear no liability by anyone.

This is a free and open meeting. No membership is required, but please RSVP.
item.name: Boston Investor's Group January Meetup
